mn151:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
mn151:1.3: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to the Buddha. He bowed and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,
mn151:2.1: “Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
mn151:2.2: What kind of meditation are you usually practicing these days?”
mn151:2.3: “Sir, these days I usually practice the meditation on emptiness.”
mn151:2.5: It seems you usually practice the meditation of a great man.
mn151:2.6: For emptiness is the meditation of a great man.
mn151:3.2: ‘May I usually practice the meditation on emptiness.’ So they should reflect:
mn151:3.3: ‘Along the path that I went for alms, or in the place I wandered for alms, or along the path that I returned from alms, was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for sights known by the eye?’
mn151:3.4: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
mn151:3.5: there was such desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in their heart, they should make an effort to give up those unskillful qualities.
mn151:3.6: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
mn151:3.7: there was no such desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in their heart, they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

mn151:9.2: ‘Have I given up the five kinds of sensual stimulation?’
mn151:9.3: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
mn151:9.4: they have not given them up, they should make an effort to do so.
mn151:9.5: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
mn151:9.6: they have given them up, they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.

mn151:11.5: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that

mn151:21.1: Whether in the past, future, or present, all those who purify their alms-food do so by continually checking in this way.
mn151:21.4: So, Sāriputta, you should all train like this: ‘We shall purify our alms-food by continually checking.’”
mn151:21.6: That is what the Buddha said.
mn151:21.7: Satisfied, Venerable Sāriputta was happy with what the Buddha said.
